Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Neck \Neck\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Necked}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Necking}.] (Mech.) To reduce the diameter of (an object) near its end, by making a groove around it; -- used with down; as, to neck down a shaft. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: neck \neck\, v. i. To kiss and caress amorously. [Colloq.] -- n. {necking}. [PJC]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: necking n 1: the molding at the top of a column [syn: {gorgerin}] 2: affectionate play (or foreplay without contact with the genital organs) [syn: {caressing}, {cuddling}, {fondling}, {hugging}, {kissing}, {petting}, {smooching}, {snuggling}]
